member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1
member.summary: Represents an in-progress composition. This can be finalized eagerly or lazily.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Then(System.Action)
member.summary: Append an action to this composition.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Then(System.Action{`0})
member.summary: Append an action to this composition.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Then``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Append a function to this composition.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Then``1(System.Func{`0,``0})
member.summary: Append a function to this composition.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Otherwise(System.Action)
member.summary: Execute an action if the composition has failed at this point. The action will be ignored if the composition is successful.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Otherwise(System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Execute an action if the composition has failed at this point. The action will be ignored if the composition is successful.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Now
member.summary: Finalize the composition and execute it eagerly. The result will be returned as an instance of Either.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Composition`1.Later
member.summary: Finalize the composition and return an instance of Lazy ready to be invoked at a later time.

member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Either`1
member.summary: Represents either a success or a failure. Either cannot be directly instanced; Use Success or Failure instead.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Either`1.Succeeded
member.summary: Determines whether this Either succeeded.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Either`1.Failed
member.summary: Determines whether this Either failed.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Either`1.GetOrElse(`0)
member.summary: Gets the value within. If the Either failed or the value cannot be recovered, other will be returned instead.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Either`1.ErrorOrElse(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the error message. If the Either succeeded or the error cannot be recovered, other will be returned instead.

member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager
member.summary: ErrorManagers attempt to execute actions and functions. Those executions return an instance of Either with the result.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager.Default
member.summary: Gets a default ErrorManager ready to attempt things.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager.Attempt(System.Action)
member.summary: Attempt to execute an action

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager.Attempt``1(System.Action{``0},``0)
member.summary: Attempt to execute an action

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager.Attempt``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Attempt to execute a function

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.ErrorManager.Attempt``2(System.Func{``0,``1},``0)
member.summary: Attempt to execute a function

member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Failure`1
member.summary: Represents a failed Either.

member.summary: Creates a new failure

member.summary: Gets the error message or an alternative if it can't be recovered.

member.summary: Determines whether this Either failed.

member.summary: Gets the result or an alternative if it can't be recovered.

member.summary: Determines whether this Either succeeded.

member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Lazy`1
member.summary: Represents a composition ready to be executed on demand.

member.name: M:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Exceptions.Lazy`1.Eval
member.summary: Invoke the composition and return the result as an instance of Either.

member.summary: Represents each of the steps in a composition.

member.summary: Invoke the step.

member.name: T:DotNet.Safe.Standard.Util.Unit
member.summary: Unit is used as a type when handling void-consuming or supplying functions. Unit only has a single instance, and it's only equal to itself.

member.summary: Get the active instance of Unit
